text: Adrienne Lyle (born January 2, 1985) is an American Olympic dressage rider. She was in the 2012 Summer Olympics in London. She was 37th place. She was also in the 2020 Summer Olympics in Tokyo. She was won a silver medal there. After being in the Grand Prix Freestyle at the 2020 Olympics, she went out from the competition. This was because she was worried about her horse named Salvino. == Career == In 2014, Lyle was picked to be at the 2014 FEI World Equestrian Games in Normandy. The United States was fourth place in team dressage. She was also at the 2018 FEI World Equestrian Games. She was part of the American team which placed second in the team event, earning the silver medal in the team event. == References == == Other websites == * * Adrienne Lyle at US Equestrian Category:1985 births Category:American equestrians Category:Dressage riders Category:Olympic silver medalists for the United States Category:Sportspeople from Washington (state) Category:Olympic equestrians for the United States
title: Adrienne Lyle
